segment.source: Drvload Command-Line Options
segment.target: Drvload Command-Line Options

segment.source: Drvload Command-Line Options
segment.target: Drvload Command-Line Options

segment.source: Drvload Command-Line Options
segment.target: Drvload Command-Line Options

segment.source: The Drvload tool adds out-of-box drivers to a booted Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) image.
segment.target: The Drvload tool adds out-of-box drivers to a booted Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE) image.

segment.source: It takes one or more driver .inf files as inputs.
segment.target: It takes one or more driver .inf files as inputs.

segment.source: To add a driver to an offline Windows PE image, use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool.
segment.target: To add a driver to an offline Windows PE image, use the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) tool.

segment.source: For more information, see Add and Remove Drivers to an Offline Windows Image.
segment.target: For more information, see Add and Remove Drivers to an Offline Windows Image.

segment.source: If the driver .inf file requires a reboot, Windows PE will ignore the request.
segment.target: If the driver .inf file requires a reboot, Windows PE will ignore the request.

segment.source: If the driver .sys file requires a reboot, then the driver cannot be added with Drvload.
segment.target: If the driver .sys file requires a reboot, then the driver cannot be added with Drvload.

segment.source: For more information, see Device Drivers and Deployment Overview and DISM Driver Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see Device Drivers and Deployment Overview and DISM Driver Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: Drivers added using the Drvload tool are marked as the preferred driver for that device.
segment.target: Drivers added using the Drvload tool are marked as the preferred driver for that device.

segment.source: If you add an updated driver during Windows Setup, the driver that you added with Drvload takes precedence.
segment.target: If you add an updated driver during Windows Setup, the driver that you added with Drvload takes precedence.

segment.source: Drvload Command-Line Options
segment.target: Drvload Command-Line Options

segment.source: The following command-line options are available for Drvload.
segment.target: The following command-line options are available for Drvload.

segment.source: drvload infpath ,infpath.../?
segment.target: drvload infpath ,infpath.../?

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Displays usage information.
segment.target: Displays usage information.

segment.source: inf_path
segment.target: inf_path

segment.source: Specifies the path to the driver .inf file.
segment.target: Specifies the path to the driver .inf file.

segment.source: The path can contain environment variables.
segment.target: The path can contain environment variables.

segment.source: If any drivers were not installed, then Drvload will return a non-zero status (%errorlevel%).
segment.target: If any drivers were not installed, then Drvload will return a non-zero status (%errorlevel%).
